cards.name: Caribou Range
cards.text:
Enchant land you control
Enchanted land has "{W}{W}, {T}: Create a 0/1 white Caribou creature token."
Sacrifice a Caribou token: You gain 1 life.

rulings.text: You can only sacrifice a Caribou token to this, not any creature with the type Caribou.

cards.originalText:
Play only on a land you control.
{W}{W}, Tap enchanted land: Put a Caribou token into play. Treat this token as a 0/1 white creature.
Sacrifice a Caribou token: Gain 1 life.

cards.name: Castle
cards.text: Untapped creatures you control get +0/+2.
cards.flavor:
"Hang out our banners on the outward walls; / The cry is still, 'They come'; our castle's strength / Will laugh a siege to scorn."
—William Shakespeare, Macbeth
cards.originalText: Each untapped creature you control gets +0/+2 unless it is attacking.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Artifacts
cards.text: {2}: The next time an artifact source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
cards.originalText: {2}: Prevent all damage to you from an artifact source. Treat further damage from that source normally.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Black
cards.text: {1}: The next time a black source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

cards.originalText: {1}: Prevent all damage to you from a black source. Treat further damage from that source normally.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Blue
cards.text: {1}: The next time a blue source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

cards.originalText: {1}: Prevent all damage to you from a blue source. Treat further damage from that source normally.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Green
cards.text: {1}: The next time a green source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

cards.originalText: {1}: Prevent all damage to you from a green source. Treat further damage from that source normally.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Red
cards.text: {1}: The next time a red source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

cards.originalText: {1}: Prevent all damage to you from a red source. Treat further damage from that source normally.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: White
cards.text: {1}: The next time a white source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

cards.originalText: {1}: Prevent all damage to you from a white source. Treat further damage from that source normally.

cards.name: Crusade
cards.text: White creatures get +1/+1.
cards.originalText: All white creatures get +1/+1.

cards.name: D'Avenant Archer
cards.text: {T}: D'Avenant Archer deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
cards.flavor: Avenant's archers are also trained as poets, so that each arrow is guided by a fragment of verse.
cards.originalText: {T}: D'Avenant Archer deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

cards.name: Death Speakers
cards.text: Protection from black
cards.flavor:
"The dead may be beyond the law, but speaking the wisdom of the dead will afford no protection!"
—Calmont, Aysen bureaucrat
cards.originalText: Protection from black

cards.name: Death Ward
cards.text: Regenerate target creature.
cards.originalText: Regenerate target creature.

cards.name: Disenchant
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

rulings.text: This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Divine Offering
cards.text: Destroy target artifact. You gain life equal to its converted mana cost.
cards.flavor: These tears of pain I weep to the skies, Not bitter drops, but water made divine. Each gem of sorrow slips, no longer mine, But proffered thus to echo other cries.

rulings.text: If the target artifact becomes illegal before resolution, you do not gain any life.
If Divine Offering resolves, but the artifact regenerates or has indestructible, you'll still gain the life.

cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact. Gain an amount of life equal to that artifact's total casting cost.

cards.name: Divine Transformation
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
cards.flavor: Glory surged through her and radiance surrounded her. All things were possible with the blessing of the Divine.
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.

cards.name: Dust to Dust
cards.text: Exile two target artifacts.
cards.flavor:
"All this nonsense made by mages
Rusts and crumbles through the ages."
—Aline Corralurn, "Inheritance"

rulings.text: If one target is removed or becomes invalid after declaration, the other target is still affected.

cards.originalText: Remove two target artifacts from the game.

cards.name: Eye for an Eye
cards.text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, instead that source deals that much damage to you and Eye for an Eye deals that much damage to that source's controller.

rulings.text: The damage dealt to you is still being dealt by the original source. The damage dealt to the other player is being dealt by Eye for an Eye.
Eye for an Eye must resolve before damage would be dealt to you in order to affect that damage.

cards.originalText: Play only when a creature, spell, or effect assigns damage to you. Eye for an Eye deals an equal amount of damage to that source's controller.

cards.name: Greater Realm of Preservation
cards.text: {1}{W}: The next time a black or red source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
cards.originalText: {1}{W}: Prevent all damage to you from a black or red source. Treat further damage from that source normally.

cards.name: Heal
cards.text:
Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor:
"Sometimes even the smallest boon can save a life."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

rulings.text: You draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep after Heal resolves, regardless of whether 1 damage was actually prevented.

cards.originalText:
Prevent 1 damage to any creature or player.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn.

cards.name: Healing Salve
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target player gains 3 life.
• Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.originalText: Target player gains 3 life, or prevent up to 3 damage to any creature or player.

cards.name: Hipparion
cards.text: Hipparion can't block creatures with power 3 or greater unless you pay {1}.
cards.flavor:
"Someone once said that hipparions are to warriors what aesthir are to skyknights. Don't believe it."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox
cards.originalText: Hipparion cannot be assigned to block any creature with power 3 or greater unless you pay an additional {1}.

cards.name: Holy Strength
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.

cards.name: Icatian Phalanx
cards.text: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.flavor: Even after the wall was breached in half a dozen places, the phalanxes fought on, standing solidly against the onrushing raiders. Disciplined and dedicated, they held their ranks to the end, even in the face of tremendous losses.

rulings.text: If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

cards.originalText: Banding

cards.name: Icatian Scout
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"In these, our final days, I offer this. Though we could not save Icatia, we gave our children time to grow, and love, before it fell."
—Ailis Connaut, diary
cards.originalText: {1}, {T}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Icatian Town
cards.text: Create four 1/1 white Citizen creature tokens.
cards.flavor: Icatia's once-peaceful towns faced increasing attacks from orcs and goblins as the climate cooled. By the time the empire fell, they were little more than armed camps.
cards.originalText: Put four Citizen tokens into play. Treat these tokens as 1/1 white creatures.

cards.name: Island Sanctuary
cards.text: If you would draw a card during your draw step, instead you may skip that draw. If you do, until your next turn, you can't be attacked except by creatures with flying and/or islandwalk.

rulings.text: If you get multiple draws or you use a spell or ability during the draw step to draw extra cards, you can have the replacement effect apply to any one or all of those. You need only have it apply once to get the effect. If you skip more than one, there is no additional effect.
If the replacement effect is applied, the effect will continue until your next turn even if this card leaves the battlefield.
Since the draw is replaced, you can't use the same draw to do other things.

cards.originalText: Skip drawing a card: Until the beginning of your next turn, only creatures with flying or islandwalk can attack you. Use this ability only during your draw phase and only once each turn.

cards.name: Ivory Guardians
cards.text:
Protection from red
Creatures named Ivory Guardians get +1/+1 as long as an opponent controls a nontoken red permanent.
cards.flavor:
"But who is to guard the guards themselves?"
—Juvenal, Satires

rulings.text: The ability of an Ivory Guardians will affect itself as well as all other creatures named Ivory Guardians (not just the ones you control).
Each ability applies a maximum of once, even if an opponent controls multiple nontoken red permanents or multiple opponents each control a nontoken red permanent.

The abilities from multiple Ivory Guardians are cumulative. For example, if you control two different Ivory Guardians and an opponent controls a nontoken red permanent, each of your Ivory Guardians will be 5/5.

cards.originalText:
Protection from red
As long as any opponent controls any red cards in play, all Guardians get +1/+1.

cards.name: Justice
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Justice unless you pay {W}{W}.
Whenever a red creature or spell deals damage, Justice deals that much damage to that creature's or spell's controller.

rulings.text: If a single source does damage to multiple targets at once, Justice will add up all the damage done and deal damage to the source's controller at one time (not multiple separate damagings).
The damage done by Justice is done as a triggered ability, which is added to the stack just after the red creature or spell deals its damage.

cards.originalText:
During your upkeep, pay {W}{W} or bury Justice.
Whenever any red creature or spell assigns damage, Justice deals an equal amount of damage to that creature's or spell's controller.

cards.name: Karma
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Karma deals damage to that player equal to the number of Swamps they control.

rulings.text: Amount of damage is determined when the ability resolves and not when it is placed on the stack.

cards.originalText: During each player's upkeep, Karma deals to that player an amount of damage equal to the number of swamps he or she controls.

cards.name: Kismet
cards.text: Artifacts, creatures, and lands your opponents control enter the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor:
"Make people wait for what they want, and you have power over them. This is as true for merchants and militia as it is for cooks and couples."
—Gwendlyn Di Corci

rulings.text: Cards enter the battlefield tapped. They do not enter the battlefield untapped and then immediately tap, therefore they do not trigger any effects due to tapping.
It affects all opponents.
Does not affect cards that phase in.

cards.originalText: Artifacts, creatures, and lands target player controls come into play tapped.

cards.name: Kjeldoran Royal Guard
cards.text: {T}: All combat damage that would be dealt to you by unblocked creatures this turn is dealt to Kjeldoran Royal Guard instead.
cards.flavor:
Honorable in battle, generous in death.
—Motto of the Kjeldoran Royal Guard

rulings.text: If you activate the ability but Kjeldoran Royal Guard leaves the battlefield before combat damage is dealt, the combat damage from unblocked creatures won't be redirected. It will be dealt to you as normal.

cards.originalText: {T}: Redirect from you to Kjeldoran Royal Guard all combat damage dealt by unblocked creatures this turn.

cards.name: Kjeldoran Skycaptain
cards.text: Flying; first strike; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.flavor: The heartlink between soldier and steed is hatched with the aesthir struggling from its shell.

rulings.text: If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

cards.originalText: Banding, flying, first strike

cards.text:
Flying
{1}{W}: Mesa Falcon gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The faith of Serra is borne on wings of hope."
—Gulsen, abbey matron
cards.originalText:
Flying
{1}{W}: +0/+1 until end of turn

cards.name: Mesa Pegasus
cards.text: Flying; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

rulings.text: If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

cards.originalText: Banding, flying

cards.name: Order of the Sacred Torch
cards.text: {T}, Pay 1 life: Counter target black spell.
cards.flavor: A blazing light to drive out the shadows.
cards.originalText: {T}, Pay 1 life: Counter target black spell. Play this ability as an interrupt.

cards.name: Order of the White Shield
cards.text:
Protection from black
{W}: Order of the White Shield gains first strike until end of turn.
{W}{W}: Order of the White Shield gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A shield of light admits no shadow.
cards.originalText:
Protection from black
{W}: First strike until end of turn
{W}{W}: +1/+0 until end of turn

cards.name: Pearled Unicorn
cards.flavor:
"'Do you know, I always thought Unicorns were fabulous monsters, too? I never saw one alive before!' 'Well, now that we have seen each other,' said the Unicorn, 'if you'll believe in me, I'll believe in you.'"
—Lewis Carroll, Through the Looking-Glass

cards.name: Personal Incarnation
cards.text:
{0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Personal Incarnation this turn is dealt to its owner instead. Only Personal Incarnation's owner may activate this ability.
When Personal Incarnation dies, its owner loses half their life, rounded up.

rulings.text: You do not lose life if this card is exiled or sent someplace without going to the graveyard first.
The owner of the Incarnation loses life when it is destroyed, not the controller. So if you control your opponent's Incarnation you can let it die to make them lose life.
If you attempt to halve a negative life total, you halve 0. This means that the life total stays the same. A life total of -10 would remain -10.

cards.originalText:
Personal Incarnation's owner may redirect any amount of damage from it to himself or herself.
If Personal Incarnation is put into any graveyard from play, its owner loses half his or her life, rounded up.

cards.name: Pikemen
cards.text: First strike; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.flavor:
"As the cavalry bore down, we faced them with swords drawn and pikes hidden in the grass at our feet. 'Don't lift your pikes 'til I give the word,' I said."
—Maeveen O'Donagh,
Memoirs of a Soldier

rulings.text: If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

cards.originalText: Banding, first strike

cards.name: Prismatic Ward
cards.text:
Enchant creature
As Prismatic Ward enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to enchanted creature by sources of the chosen color.
cards.originalText:
When you play Prismatic Ward, choose a color.
All damage dealt to enchanted creature by sources of the chosen color is reduced to 0.

cards.name: Repentant Blacksmith
cards.text: Protection from red
cards.flavor:
"For my confession they burned me with fire / And found that I was for endurance made."
—The Arabian Nights,
trans. Haddawy
cards.originalText: Protection from red

cards.name: Reverse Damage
cards.text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.

rulings.text: It only affects damage dealt by the source one time. If the source damages you a second time this turn, the damage will not be reversed.

cards.originalText: All damage dealt to you so far this turn from one source is retroactively added to your life total instead of subtracted. Treat further damage from that source normally.

cards.name: Righteousness
cards.text: Target blocking creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"I too shall be brought low by death, but until then let me win glory."
—Homer, Iliad, Book XVIII

rulings.text: A "blocking creature" is one that has been declared as a blocker this combat, or one that was put onto the battlefield blocking this combat. Unless that creature leaves combat, it continues to be a blocking creature through the end of combat step, even if the creature or creatures it was blocking are no longer on the battlefield or have otherwise left combat.

cards.originalText: Target blocking creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.

cards.name: Sacred Boon
cards.text: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn. At the beginning of the next end step, put a +0/+1 counter on that creature for each 1 damage prevented this way.
cards.flavor:
"Divine gifts are granted to those who are worthy."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest
cards.originalText: Prevent up to 3 damage to target creature. At end of turn, put a +0/+1 counter on that creature for each 1 damage prevented in this way.

cards.name: Samite Healer
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.flavor: Healers ultimately acquire the divine gifts of spiritual and physical wholeness. The most devout are also granted the ability to pass physical wholeness on to others.
cards.originalText: {T}: Prevent 1 damage to any creature or player.

cards.name: Seraph
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Seraph this turn dies, put that card onto the battlefield under your control at the beginning of the next end step. Sacrifice the creature when you lose control of Seraph.

rulings.text: You do not get the creature back if the creature is not still in the graveyard at the end of the turn.

If Seraph isn't on the battlefield at the time the other creature is put into a graveyard, the ability won't trigger. However, the ability does trigger if Seraph and the other creature are put into the graveyard at the same time.
If the other creature is a token, it will cease to exist after being exiled. It won't be returned to the battlefield.

If the other creature ceases to be a creature card after it leaves the battlefield (it's an animated Mishra's Factory, for example), it will be returned to the battlefield by this ability and you will have to sacrifice it when you lose control of Seraph.

Once the ability triggers, you'll return the card to the battlefield under your control at the end of the turn even if you no longer control Seraph at that time. In fact, if Seraph leaves the battlefield before the card is returned to the battlefield, you'll never have to sacrifice it as a result of this ability. If Seraph remains on the battlefield but changes controllers before the card is returned, you'll still get the returned card. However, in that scenario, you'll still have to sacrifice it if you later regain control Seraph and then lose control of it once more.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever any creature Seraph damaged this turn is put into any graveyard, put that creature into play under your control at end of turn. Bury the creature if you lose control of Seraph.

cards.name: Serra Bestiary
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Serra Bestiary unless you pay {W}{W}.
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities with {T} in their costs can't be activated.

rulings.text: Does prevent the use of activated mana abilities with {T} in the cost.
Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

cards.originalText:
During your upkeep, pay {W}{W} or bury Serra Bestiary.
Enchanted creature cannot attack, block, or play any ability that includes {T} in its activation cost.

cards.name: Serra Paladin
cards.text:
{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
{1}{W}{W}, {T}: Target creature gains vigilance until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
One light, one blade, one purpose.
—Vow of the Serra Paladins
cards.originalText:
{T}: Prevent 1 damage to any creature or player.
{1}{W}{W}, {T}: Attacking this turn does not cause target creature to tap.

cards.name: Shield Bearer
cards.text: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.flavor:
"You have almost completed your four years, my son. Soon you shall be a skyknight."
—Arna Kennerüd, skyknight

rulings.text: If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

cards.originalText: Banding

cards.name: Shield Wall
cards.text: Creatures you control get +0/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The strongest walls are made not of stone or steel but of the focused strength of warriors.
cards.originalText: All creatures you control get +0/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Spirit Link
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.
cards.flavor:
"I regret feeding Kaervek's hunger for power—far better to live with animals innocent of such ambitions."
—Jolrael

rulings.text: You only gain the life when the triggered ability resolves. If you are reduced to zero life before the ability resolves, you will lose before gaining the life.

You gain life for all damage which is not prevented, regardless of what the creature damages (player or another creature) or the toughness of the blocking creature. If you put this on a 5/5 and it is blocked by a 1/1, you still gain 5 life.

cards.originalText: For each 1 damage enchanted creature deals, gain 1 life.

cards.name: Truce
cards.text: Each player may draw up to two cards. For each card less than two a player draws this way, that player gains 2 life.
cards.flavor:
Not all victories require defeat.
—Onean idiom
cards.originalText: Each player may draw up to two cards. For each card less than two any player draws, that player gains 2 life.

cards.name: Tundra Wolves
cards.text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.flavor: I heard their eerie howling, the wolves calling their kindred across the frozen plains.
cards.originalText: First strike

cards.name: Wall of Swords
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
cards.flavor: Just as the evil ones approached to slay Justina, she cast a great spell, imbuing her weapons with her own life force. Thus she fulfilled the prophecy: "In the death of your savior will you find salvation."
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: White Knight
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from black (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black.)
cards.flavor: Out of the blackness and stench of the engulfing swamp emerged a shimmering figure. Only the splattered armor and ichor-stained sword hinted at the unfathomable evil the knight had just laid waste.
cards.originalText: First strike, protection from black

cards.name: Wrath of God
cards.text: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.
cards.originalText: Bury all creatures.

cards.name: Swamp
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Swamp
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Bottomless Vault
cards.text:
Bottomless Vault enters the battlefield tapped.
You may choose not to untap Bottomless Vault during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Bottomless Vault is tapped, put a storage counter on it.
{T}, Remove any number of storage counters from Bottomless Vault: Add {B} for each storage counter removed this way.

rulings.text: It is only considered "tapped for mana" if you activate its mana ability and generate mana from it.
This enters the battlefield tapped even if a continuous effect immediately changes it to something else.
If the land is tapped by some external effect, no counters are removed from it.
Counters are not lost if the land is changed to another land type. They wait around for the land to change back.

Whether or not it is tapped is checked at the beginning of upkeep. If it is not tapped, the ability does not trigger. It also checks during resolution and you only get a counter if it is still tapped then.

cards.originalText:
Bottomless Vault comes into play tapped.
You may choose not to untap Bottomless Vault during your untap phase and put a storage counter on it instead.
{T}, Remove X storage counters from Bottomless Vault: Add an amount of {B} equal to X to your mana pool.

cards.name: City of Brass
cards.text:
Whenever City of Brass becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add one mana of any color.

rulings.text: The first ability triggers no matter how the land becomes tapped.

If you tap City of Brass while you are casting a spell or activating an ability, its ability will trigger and wait. When you finish casting that spell or activating that ability, City of Brass's triggered ability is put on the stack on top of it. City of Brass's ability will resolve first.

On the other hand, you can tap City of Brass, put its triggered ability on the stack, and then respond to that ability by casting an instant or activating an ability using that mana. In that case, the instant spell or activated ability will resolve first.

cards.originalText:
Whenever City of Brass becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Ice Floe
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Ice Floe during your untap step.
{T}: Tap target creature without flying that's attacking you. It doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as Ice Floe remains tapped.

rulings.text: You may target a tapped creature with Ice Floe's activated ability.
The targeted creature is not removed from combat. Its attack will continue as normal.

If the ability resolves, then the creature gains flying later, Ice Floe's effect will not end. (The ability checks whether the creature has flying only at the time you activate it and the time it resolves.)

If the affected creature is untapped by some other spell or ability, Ice Floe's effect will not end. If you keep Ice Floe tapped, and that creature becomes tapped again, Ice Floe will continue to prevent it from being untapped during its controller's untap step.
Ice Floe doesn't track the creature's controller. If the affected creature changes controllers, Ice Floe will prevent it from being untapped during its new controller's untap step.

If Ice Floe untaps or leaves the battlefield, its effect will end. This has no immediate visible affect on the creature. (It doesn't untap immediately, for example.) The creature will just untap as normal during its controller's next untap step.

cards.originalText:
You may choose not to untap Ice Floe during your untap phase.
{T}: Tap target creature without flying that is attacking you. As long as Ice Floe remains tapped, that creature does not untap during its controller's untap phase.

cards.name: Urza's Mine
cards.text: {T}: Add {C}. If you control an Urza's Power-Plant and an Urza's Tower, add {C}{C} instead.
cards.flavor: Mines became common as cities during the days of the artificers.

rulings.text: If you have at least one of each of the three Urza's lands on the battlefield, you must take the 2 mana instead of just one.

cards.originalText: {T}: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool. If you control Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, and Urza's Tower, add two colorless mana to your mana pool instead of one.

cards.originalText: {T}: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool. If you control Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, and Urza's Tower, add three colorless mana to your mana pool instead of one.

cards.name: Armed Response
cards.text: Armed Response deals damage to target attacking creature equal to the number of Equipment you control.
cards.flavor: Raksha watched as the goblins continued to pour onto the Razor Fields. "They just don't know when to stop, do they?"
cards.originalText: Armed Response deals damage to target attacking creature equal to the number of Equipment you control.

cards.name: Auriok Champion
cards.text:
Protection from black and from red
Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"Her will shall banish the shadows. Her might shall punish the lawless. Her beauty shall restore the light."
—Ushanti, leonin seer

rulings.text: Gaining life when a creature enters the battlefield is optional.

foreignNames.name: オーリオックのチャンピオン

cards.originalText:
Protection from black and from red
Whenever another creature comes into play, you may gain 1 life.

cards.name: Auriok Salvagers
cards.text: {1}{W}: Return target artifact card with converted mana cost 1 or less from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: "Memnarch or the vedalken salvage most of the large machines, leaving us only scraps. Scraps are enough."

rulings.text: If a card in a graveyard has X in its mana cost, X is considered to be 0.

foreignNames.name: オーリオックの廃品回収者

cards.originalText: {1}{W}: Return target artifact card with converted mana cost 1 or less from your graveyard to your hand.
